data.title: Merge conflict - compare changes view: Next change / previous change make no sense
data.body:
Refs: #27549

1. Have a merge confclist, click on the compare chagnes view
2. Notice that none of the title bar actions have any effect in this view. And show next / previous change make no sense here. They should not be shown or at least be disabled

data.title: Merge conflicts: no way to go back from compare changes to diff view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #27549

1. have a merge conflict, click on compare changes
2. click on the `show file` action in the title bar -> it has no effect, I would expect that it goes back to the file with all my merge conflicts

![noaction](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26586117/7e70828a-454e-11e7-9bb6-67646a20bfe0.gif)

data.title: Feautre: Open Files for Window Pane listed in "..." button
data.body: Similar to issue #27557, open files are not listed under the "..." ellipses for the Tab Group. Instead, an additional menu open for "Show Opened Editors" is needed to be clicked to show a listing. This vastly distracts from the speed of working within VSCode. It also counters what Visual Studio 201x versions do, which is to immediately list all open files in that Tab Group as soon as clicking the dropdown arrow. ## Suggested Fix List open files for the Tab Group in the "..." button dropdown. Just like Visual Studio has been doing since VS 2010. ## Additional Info There is a feature using the Left navigation bar that shows the LEFT and RIGHT panels (and I assume LEFT/MIDDLE/RIGHT when using 3 views): I, like many of peers on **small screens**, keep this left nav bar closed and can't utilize it. All that is needed is a quick click to list the files. ## Setup VSCode Version: Version 1.12.2 (1.12.2) 2017-05-10T13:10:24.631Z OS Version: macOS 10.12.5 ## Steps to Reproduce: Split Vertical Open several files in each split

data.title: Toggling line comment on certain file types breaks when there is already a comment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Take the following CSS code:
```css
paper-item {
	 height: 10px;
	 color: var(--komed-font-color-blue);
	/*border: solid;*/
	/*border-width: 1px;*/
	 margin-left: 3%;
	 font-size: 14px;

}
```
2. If I toggle line comment now on line 3 to 6 (select the lines and press the command shortcut for line comment)
3. Then the comments actually break because there already was some comments
```
paper-item {
	 height: 10px;
	 color: var(--komed-font-color-blue);
	border: solid;*/
	/*border-width: 1px;
	 margin-left: 3%;
	 font-size: 14px;

}
```


This only happens to file extensions where there is no actual "line comment". So CSS for example or HTML. For a JS file the editor fills in the appropriate amount of `//` comments

data.title: Stopping the debug session is not stopping the node server running in docker
data.body:
Testing #27462

- Follow the steps in recipe ["Debugging Docker with Source maps"](https://github.com/weinand/vscode-recipes/tree/master/Docker-TypeScript):
- Launch the node in Docker using debug configuration `Launch in Docker`
- Server starts and everything is good
- Stop the debug session

Expected to stop the node server in Docker. But it is observed that it still runs. 
I can stop it only by killing it in the terminal.

data.title: Merge conflicts: cmd + click on compare changes should open it side by side
data.body:
Refs: #27549

LIke in all other places in the workbench, cmd / ctrl + click opens the editor to the side.
The same way cmd / ctrl + click on compare changes should open it to the side

data.title: Too Many Buttons on Tab Bar
data.body: ## Expected Behavior Use the single, stationary "..." button to house all dynamic buttons, searches, and files without changing the "Tabs" width and size. ## Actual Behavior Too many buttons disappear and reappear depending on what has focus. This creates a jarring experience with multiple files open in each pane. If focused on the RIGHT pane, and clicking on the LEFT Pane, the Tabs all shift and squish to the left to make room for the buttons. They should instead be listed under the "..." button, because they are infrequently used. ## Setup - VSCode Version: Version 1.12.2 (1.12.2) 2017-05-10T13:10:24.631Z - OS Version: macOS 10.12.5 ## Steps to Reproduce: 1. Split Vertical 1. Open several files in each split

data.title: Automated Smoke Test: prevent VS Code from auto updating

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
testing #27456:

I was running the Automated Smoke Test with an older version of VS Code.
But I was not seeing the expected improvement because VS Code auto updates itself while running the Automated Smoke Tests.

I suggest to disable the auto updating while running the Automated Smoke Test.

data.title: Make the Automated Smoke Test faster

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #27456

On my Surface Book running the integration tests took 14m.

I would expect the integration tests to run a lot faster. Some ideas:

* keep the VS Code window opened between tests
* only if a test fails initially, rerun the test with a fresh VS Code window (and increased timeouts)

data.title: js loop switch and .ts types
data.body:
The "interpreter" is considering a redux pattern (braces followed by colon in each case of switch), as type of .ts files.

![bug_ts](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1781596/26584943/080af3aa-4521-11e7-922b-2cc7114cd690.png)

Message: **[js] 'types' can only be used in a .ts file.**

About [pattern](https://medium.com/@e_himmelfarb/use-curly-braces-with-es6-let-and-const-in-switch-blocks-react-redux-reducers-c0b01b37d748)

data.title: editor.multicursorModifier not discoverable (add toggle menu item)
data.body:
Refs: #27480

The setting `editor.multicursorModifier` is not that discoverable, I as a user would not even think about looking there. In order to impove this I would consider adding a toggle action "Use ctrl + click to add cursor / use altr + click to add cursor" in the selection menu which already has all the multi cursor actions.

Without that the only way users find it is via googling around / stack overflow

data.title: No indication that "editor.multicursorModifier" affects go to definition behavior
data.body:
Refs: #27480

Currently we have no indication that multicurosrModifier will affect the behavior of go to definition. I would expect that this is mentioned in the hover message.

data.title: Test merge conflict editor
data.body:
Testing #27150

Complexity 2

- [x] Linux @aeschli
- [x] Windows @michelkaporin 
- [x] Mac @isidorn 

From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27288#issuecomment-304138928:
To simulate a merge conflict, create a file with the following content
```
aaa
bbb
<<<<<<< HEAD
ccc
ccc
=======
ddd
ddd
>>>>>>> somebranch
eee
eee
```
- Test the new 'merge' commands in the command palate
- Test the code lens actions (set "editor.codeLens": true)
- Test that you can theme the merge editor with these colors:
    `merge.currentContentBackground`
    `merge.currentHeaderBackground`
    `merge.incomingContentBackground`
    `merge.incomingHeaderBackground`
    `overviewRuler.currentContentForeground`
    `overviewRuler.incomingContentForeground`

data.title: Annotation tasks break old 0.1.0 task behaviour
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows.

Tasks.json
```ts
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "_runner": "terminal",
  "command": "yarn",
  "suppressTaskName": true,
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "echoCommand": true,
  "tasks": [
    {
      "taskName": "clean - clean built content",
      "args": ["run", "clean"],
      "showOutput": "never"
    }, {
      "taskName": "build - build project",
      "args": ["run", "build"],
      "isBuildCommand": true,
      "problemMatcher": ["$tsc"]
    }, {
      "taskName": "copy statics - copy static content to the build",
      "args": ["run", "copystatics"]
    }, {
      "taskName": "lint - check code conventions",
      "args": ["run", "lint"],
      "problemMatcher": ["$tslint5"]
    }, {
      "taskName": "lint & fix - check and fix code conventions",
      "args": ["run", "lint:fix"],
      "problemMatcher": ["$tslint5"]
    }
  ]
}
```

Steps:

- F1 > Run task

Observe: the list only contains one generic yarn task although it should contain 5 tasks. 

This is caused by the new feature we added to allow annotating tasks in the tasks.json that come from an extension. To not break to many users we need to address this. I see the following options:

1. we make the annotation more explicit with a taskAnnotation section.
2. we make the annotation algorithm more complex. A task only annotates if a extension really contributes a task with the same name or id. If no such task exists we try to treat it as a 0.1.0 task definition.
3. We officially support a runner attribute: The following combination would be valid:
`version: 0.1.0` & (`runner: output` | `runner: terminal`) and `version: 2.0.0` & `runner: terminal`). This allows users to use the terminal runner with the old syntax. The 2.0.0 syntax will can be breaking (for example no global task definition, ...) and is only supported with the terminal runner.

@egamma any preferences. I personally would opt for 3 (you suggested this for a different reason end of last week. Should have listened :-)) and then 2. 3 would give us the most flexibility in the future.

data.title: SVG viewer preview shows bogus preview until focus changes
data.body:
Refs: #27350

Not sure if this is caused by extension, assigning to you so you decide.

1. Install svg viewer, open an svg, for example `configure.svg` in our repo
2. View svg
3. In the editor group where the svg is shown open another file and go back to the svg, notice how we now show a bogus preview
4. Note that the preview gets in a good shape once some other editor gets focus

![svg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26583382/4b4a0ba0-4545-11e7-85a1-be97e346cb6d.gif)

data.title: Quick Open resets selection when search finishes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:16:25.899Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-75-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|you-complete-me|RichardHe|1.0.35|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4|
|togglehs|bbenoist|0.1.2|
|vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.3.0|
|chromium-codesearch|chaopeng|0.0.7|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|1.1.0|
|monokai-plusplus|dcasella|1.6.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|an-old-hope-theme-vscode|dustinsanders|2.0.0|
|Theme-Monokai|gerane|0.0.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.2|
|copy-file-name|nemesv|1.0.0|
|difftomaster|pavolmarko|0.0.1|
|proto|peterj|0.0.2|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|
|rewrap|stkb|1.3.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In a large repo like Chromium, open Quick open (CTRL+P).
2. Enter a search term, e.g. 'arc'.
3. While the search proceeds in the background (running blue bar indicator shows), select an item other than the first (arrow up/down).
4. Wait until the search finishes.

Expected: The same item is still selected.
Actual: The selection resets and the first item is selected.

This often leads to opening the wrong item when the search finishes right in the moment when one hits enter.

data.title: Inconsistent tab stop behaviour with recursive snippets and tab / shift tab
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13 Insider
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394 

Snippet:
```js
	"nls-snippet": {
		"prefix": "nls",
		"body": [
			"nls.localize(${1:nl}, '${2:value}')$0"
		]
	}
```
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Inset snippet
1. move cursor behind nl and open code assist
1. insert nls snippet again
1. tab through the tab stops until the last 'value' is selected (observe: the $0 from the first snippet insert is visisted)
1. Shift tab. Observe: move immediately back to the first 'value'. 

IMO we shouldn't visit the $0 of the first snippet insert while tabbing.

data.title: $TM_LINE_INDEX is zero based. I would expect it to be one based
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13 Insider
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394 

Snippet:
```
	"nls-snippet": {
		"prefix": "nls",
		"body": [
			"nls.localize($TM_LINE_INDEX);$0"
		]
	}
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. execute on line 2 (according to the line number ruler)
1. you get: nls.localize(1);

data.title: Default text not inserted with TM_SELECTED_TEXT
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Snippet
```json
	"nls-snippet": {
		"prefix": "nls",
		"body": [
			"nls.localize('${1:key}', ${TM_SELECTED_TEXT:'value'});$0"
		]
	}
```
1. insert that snippet with nothing selected.

Observe: you get
```js
    nls.localize('key', nls);
```

I expected to get nls.localize('key', 'value'); where both key and value are tab stops

data.body:
Testing #27456 on macOS:

Are all of the following 22 test failures really a result of #27452?

```
Running tests...




  Smoke Test Suite

    Data Migration

      1) checks if the Untitled file is restored migrating from stable to latest

      ✓ checks if the newly created dirty file is restored migrating from stable to latest

      ✓ cheks if opened tabs are restored migrating from stable to latest

    Data Loss

      ✓ verifies that 'hot exit' works for dirty files

      2) verifies that contents of the dirty files are restored after 'hot exit'

    Explorer

      ✓ quick open search produces correct result

      ✓ quick open respects fuzzy matching

    Configuration and views

      ✓ turns off editor line numbers and verifies the live change

      ✓ changes 'workbench.action.toggleSidebarPosition' command key binding and verifies it (27655ms)

    Search

      ✓ searches for body & checks for correct result number

      ✓ searches only for *.js files & checks for correct result number

      ✓ dismisses result & checks for correct result number

      ✓ replaces first search result with a replace term

    CSS

      4) verifies warnings for the empty rule

      5) verifies that warning becomes an error once setting changed

    JavaScript

     Error: the string "Could not retrieve the element in 45 seconds." was thrown, throw an Error :)
  

  21) Smoke Test Suite Tasks verifies build errors are reflected in 'Problems View':
     Error: the string "Could not retrieve the element in 45 seconds." was thrown, throw an Error :)
  


  22) Smoke Test Suite Localization starts with 'DE' locale and verifies title and viewlets text is in German:

      AssertionError: 'quellcodeverwaltung' == 'quellcodeverwaltung: git'
      + expected - actual

      -quellcodeverwaltung
      +quellcodeverwaltung: git
      
      at Context.<anonymous> (out/tests/localization.js:42:24)
      at Generator.next (<anonymous>)

      at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:129:7)






npm ERR! Test failed.  See above for more details.
```

data.title: Resolving modules and Intellisense Autocompletion pretty slow
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.18.0|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|3.5.1|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.17.1|
|vscode-console-wrapper|fabiodam|0.4.0|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|sublime-babel-vscode|joshpeng|0.2.5|
|atom-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.0.1|
|sort-imports|peterjuras|2.3.1|
|better-merge|pprice|0.7.0|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.8.1|
|gitflow|vector-of-bool|1.1.0|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|
|ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.3.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.1|;


---

Resolving modules and Intellisense Autocompletion in our Project takes a long time...

![bq7zrobog0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6916518/26581019/ea9fa9ae-453a-11e7-97d0-e8dac83be7f5.gif)

Maybe this problem is a result of using absolute paths.
Here is our `jsconfig.json` of the project:
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6",
    "module": "es6",
    "baseUrl": "./",  // all paths are relative to the baseUrl
    "paths": {
      "~/*" : ["*"]   // resolve any `~/foo/bar` to `<baseUrl>/foo/bar`
    }
  },
  "exclude": [
    "api",
    "build",
    "node_modules",
    "public",
    "seeds",
    "sql_updates",
    "tests.build"
  ]
}
```

Can i somehow debug which directories VSCode is resolving to find my correct file.
And is there maybe a way to cache this resolved pathy specific for this IDE on my Client... to make the IDE not search my Filesystem every time - or do you plan on make this in the future

data.title: Status bar color
data.body:
I've visual studio code installed on 5 machines, some with status bar as BLUE and some as PURPLE. 

Any difference ?!

data.title: Cannot run integration test while having the vim extension installed
data.body:
Testing #27456

I have the vim extension installed and disabled (always), but it looks like the integration test picks it up and enables it. This causes the integration test to fail in the Data Migration -> checks if the Untitled file is restored migrating from stable to latest test

I will continue by uninstalling the vim extension.

data.title: Consider allowing to provide context menu commands in code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re #27467

I like how I can have the primary `command` for a TreeItem, esp. with arguments and I think we should discuss again if we should have that also for context menu actions

data.title: Command arguments are messed up
data.body:
re #27467

The API allows me to have a real `Command` with arguments but they get lost in `massageTreeItem`. You should use [`ExtHostCommands#converter`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHostCommands.ts#L46) to get full support for this
